alert.note: Alert for Boone; Gallatin; Grant (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 2:38PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, CENTRAL SWITZERLAND, SOUTHERN BOONE, NORTHWESTERN GRANT AND CENTRAL GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 237 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Florence, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Rising Sun, Warsaw, Florence, Glencoe, Patriot, Ethridge, Center Square, Aberdeen, Big Bone Lick, Interstate 71 at US Route 127, Steele Bottom, Markland, Napoleon, US Routes 42 and 127 at State Route 562, East Enterprise, Rabbit Hash, Allensville, Quercus Grove, North Landing and Jacksonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
